title: For Holly
name: For Holly
description:
A Map by Mcmcilvoy

This is my small gift to you.  A map of the places we've been together. I will grow this map, and add each place we visit. I have been filled with awe at the thrill I get each time I remember some place I shared with you.

properties.name: Katy and Vanessa's
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 617 Clayton St, San Francisco, CAI nearly flaked us out of coming to this party. I accurately predicted both the quality of the food (excellent) and the quality of the air (smokey).

properties.name: Amnesia
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  853 Valencia St, San Francisco, CAThe Unauthorized Autobiography of Kim Deal. Some rocking out. I may have been in drag. Never. Again.

properties.name: Andalu
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy3198 16th St, San Francisco, CAbirthday dinner!

properties.name: Apple Store
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 1 Stockton StWe met up here after one of my good old schmoozefests. A glass staircase is the next best thing to a glass elevator, don\'t you think?

properties.name: Arch
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy99 Missouri, San Francisco, CAAfter Max\'s brunch, we went here. In part to buy maxmoviesupplies. In part to buy transit stuff bags.

properties.name: Boogaloos
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy3296 22nd St, San Francisco, CABreif brunch with Lita, Jason, Carrie and Joe. I fled the scene to sit here at work! Man, that sucks!

properties.name: Bottom of the Hill
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 1233 17th St, San Francisco, CAWe saw the New Amsterdams. You were carded, even though I wasn\'t with you! It was here that I began to doubt that I\'m the one lowering your AARP credential.

properties.name: Bullshead Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 840 Ulloa St, San Francisco, CABullshead Restaurant (415) 665-4350

properties.name: CGI Moonworks, DKF
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy1800 Seaport Blvd, Redwood City, CALunch by the Junkyard. Dream Kid Farm: Growing ones and zeros like nobody else. It\'s the moonfish they put in the fertilizer that does it.

properties.name: Cafe Petra
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy    483 GUERRERO STREET, San Francisco, CAWe sometimes met here, before your tremendous lock-opening gifts! We may yet go here again!

properties.name: Cafe Reverie
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  848 Cole St, San Francisco, CACafe Reverie is Cole Valley\'s communal heart. Patio out back. The sidewalk out front is the home of the Poetry Canvass. We may have missed the butterflies from here. Trying to Find a Botanist My campaign to meet a botanist has never really been on solid footing. Our first mistake was starting our search by agreeing not to go to the one place we could be confident there were botanists, the conservatory of flowers.

properties.name: Café Du Nord
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  2170 Market Street, San Francisco, CAStreet to Nowhere (meh) The 88 (which brought you there) Birdmonster (which brought me there) This place brought us together. All I wanted was to check my coat, I didn\'t know I\'d fall in love!

properties.name: Canvas Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy    1200 9th Ave, San Francisco, CACanvas Cafe. We came here after the park, sat down in the window seats. I probably spilled on myself. We found our neighborhood postcards here!

properties.name: Castro Theater
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  429 Castro St, San Francisco, CA Kubrick Double feature! A Clockwork Orange AND The Shining. Another notable instance of me being pennyless when it counts! No TV and no beer make homer go something something . . .

properties.name: Citrus Club
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy1790 Haight St, San Francisco, CAPan-Asian food that one time. This was during the rain.

properties.name: Country Station Sushi
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor2140 Mission St, San Francisco, CAOwned by legendary Butoh dancers

properties.name: Crepes on Cole
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy100 Carl St, San Francisco, CACrepes on Cole. A place for crepes. They are always hiring, and they only hire girls, and the turnover is insane, which gives me the creeps. Creeps and crepes. I recommend the Cole Valley

properties.name: De Young Tower
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  This tower was all ours. We checked out the map, we might have made out a little, it was good times. They finally had to kick us out. Anyway, that\'s my version of things.

properties.name: Dolores Park Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy    501 Dolores St, San Francisco, CABreakfast on the day of yarn shopping. Ran into my old friend Pete. Bagels!

properties.name: Ebisu Japanese Cuisine
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy1283 9th Ave, San Francisco, CAWe ate sushi here, too. (Twice!) Once, after going to the De Young, and again, just to eat something. I have a hard time ordering from the bar here, it seems. Still plotting to steal their coat rack.

properties.name: Empire Theater
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  85 West Portal Ave, San Francisco, CAThank You for Smoking. I mean, you are smoking! As in hot. And not on fire, except in a metaphorical sense. Although, most definitely metaphorically on fire. Someone, please call the Analogy department. By which I mean English department. Because I am seriously in need of a refresher course! Once again, that little plastic wallet saved they day! (What\'s up with these cash only theaters?!)

properties.name: Francisco's
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 1008 Masonic St, San Francisco, CAWe came here after eating at Citrus Club. The top level state secret of goat hill was revealed. Max signed our death warrants. Then we watched the Sopranos

properties.name: Great American Music Hall
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  859 Ofarrell St, San Francisco, CASleater-Kinney! That weird comic act! Costly coat check (ccc) You even bought my beer!

properties.name: Home
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy2100 Market St, San Francisco, CAFirst Monthaversery! I was very suave- flowers at the table, bread ready to eat - but you lovely! In fact, stunning!

properties.name: If I Could Plot On A Map The Way My Heart Points Towards You!
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoywhich I can not do, though I have tried, this compass-heart would be worth more; the tidal chart which governs the moments I am overcome with admiration or utterly immodest lust would be usable; I would always know the best, quickest way to get to the Left and Right Shoulder Freckle Galaxies; I would know what to do and what not to, not to, not to tickle your feet, not that. No. I promise. I would know to lock your car, I would. I promise. If only I had a map. Too bad I don’t, really. If only I had that map. But you- You are unplotable. You are. There is too much in you, too much nuanced loveliness, too many surprising wonders. Too much brilliance. Unplotable. I am lucky, though. Lucky to have this guide-dog-heart, which can see or smell or taste the way. I can feel it reading the world like Braille and I know to trust that you are this way, this way, this way.

properties.name: Imagi Knit
properties.description: Posted by McmcilvoyYarrr! I mean, Yarrn! We bought my scarf, in the raw. Also, ball spinners rule!

properties.name: Just For You
properties.description: Posted by Boomboxnation 3rd st. and 22nd st. san franciscoYum.

properties.name: Kabuki Theater
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  1881 Post St, San Francisco, CAV for Vendetta? Natalie Portman? BALD? Japantown? Glass Elevator? I\'m in! What more could you want!

properties.name: Kezar Track
properties.description: Posted by McmcilvoyRunning running running early in the morning!

properties.name: La Tortilla
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 495 Castro St, San Francisco, CALa Tortilla. How better to prepare for a night with Kubrick than to eat a burrito? 9.5 mustaches!

properties.name: Lake Berryessa
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 7600 Knoxville Rd, 94558You rock, triathlete!

properties.name: Max's
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy Max\'s apartment. We had brunch! A bunch of Brunch!

properties.name: Maxfields
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 398 Dolores St, San Francisco, CAOK. So we haven\'t been inside together at once. You did wait outside while I got us coffee that time you dropped me off at work in the morning.

properties.name: Medjool
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy2516 Mission St, San Francisco, CAWe came here after we met up at the apple store. Quince, Quince, what are you? Everything Good Between Men and Women has been written in mud and butter and barbecue sauce. The walls and the floors used to be gorgeous. The socks off-white and a near match. The quince with fireblight but we get two pints of jelly in the end. Long walks strengthen the back. You with a fever blister and myself with a sty. Eyes have we and we are forever prey to one another’s teeth. The torrents go over us. Thunder has not harmed anyone we know. The river coursing through us is dirty and deep. The left hand protects the rhythm. Watch your head. No fires should be unattended. Especially when wind. Each receives a free swiss army knife. The first few tongues are clearly preparatory. The impression made by yours I carry to my grave. It is just so sad so creepy so beautiful. Bless it. We have so little time to learn, so much. . . . The river courses dirty and deep. Cover the lettuce. Call it a night. O soul. Flow on. Instead. Fire blight is destructive to apples and quince and is the most serious pear disease in the eastern United States. Caused by the bacterium Erwinia amylovora, the disease can attack some 75 species of plants of the rose family. Fire blight also occurs frequently on pyracantha, spirea, hawthorn, and mountain ash. In fruit trees, the disease can kill blossoms, fruit, shoots, limbs, and tree trunks. Certain varieties of apples are more susceptible than others. Susceptible varieties include Jonathan, Rome, Yellow Transparent, and Idared.

properties.name: Minako Organic Sushi
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 2154 Mission St, San Francisco, CAAfter country station washed out, we ended up going here. We were steaming. Maybe because we were soaking wet, maybe just because.

properties.name: Panthouse
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 268 Carl St, San Francisco, CAA House of Pants. Domicile for Maq, Scott, Nora, Dave, Emily, Max, Izzy and Steve the Ottoman Turtle.

properties.name: Philosopher's Club
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy824 Ulloa St, San Francisco, CANew Friday destination. I was so very wrong about the whole meal situation there! Even so, they did have forks!

properties.name: Philz Coffee
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 3901 18th St, San Francisco, CAWe had coffee here waiting for the 33. This was after yarn adventures

properties.name: Platanos
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 598 Guerrero St, San Francisco, CAOne more place we went for coffee. I can\'t remember, did you have coffee? I had coffee, I know.

properties.name: Plutos
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 627 Irving St, San Francisco, CAI go here for the plate of meat. I\'m pretty sure you had a salad.

properties.name: Portal at West Portal
properties.description: Posted by McmcilvoyWest Portal Ave and Ulloa Street, San Francisco, CAWhere we met for the second time. The Gav, Mike Nevin, Alice Toklas, waving signs, chanting I Like Mike! I was so happy that you came!

properties.name: Public Affairs Associats
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy601 Gateway Blvd, South San Francisco, CAMike, Mike, what\'s not to like?

properties.name: Safeway
properties.description: Posted by McmcilvoyA couple of visits here, right? Midnight Safeway run for last minute Bed Day necessities was my favorite. Champagne and Strawberries

properties.name: Slims
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  333 11th St, San Francisco, CAStart wearing purple, wearing purple . . . Gypsy Punk While dancing in a circle I experiment with lifting one knee in the air and jumping up and down until I get an elbow in the back. A man with a mustache surfs the crowd on a giant drum and he plays the drum by jumping up and down now the crowd has climbed onstage and we can not see a single band member and then the drum is back on top of the crowd and then there he is again, up on top easily 25 feet off the floor! It is at this time that I am made conscious of my own lack of credentials as a punk, gypsy or otherwise, as I find myself wondering if the band members are entitled to workman’s comp should one of them be seriously injured while performing!

properties.name: Squat & Gobble Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  1 West Portal Ave, San Francisco, cAAfter the Philosophers Club failed to pony up with some food, we resorted crepes! Remember the weird and beautiful artwork?

properties.name: Tart to Tart
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy641 Irving St., SF.A good place for a heart to heart? I should not be allowed make puns.

properties.name: Tennis Courts on Stanyan
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy Tennis! We bashed a ball around with Nate and Ethan. In my reality, we won.

properties.name: The Fillmore
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 1805 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CAMetric. The Islands. I gave you a rose. We ate in the car. Then, we rocked out!

properties.name: The Page
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy298 Divisadero Street, San Francisco, CA, United StatesBradens birthday party. You meet the other Holly for the first time. This came hard on after Oscar night.

properties.name: Ti Couz Creperie
properties.description: Posted by Jimyoung 3108 16th St, San Francisco, CA 94103

properties.name: West Portal Poetry Canvass
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  118 West Portal Ave, San Francisco, CAA near miss! This is the corner I never read to you from!

properties.name: Your Place
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy 3525 17th Street, San Francisco, CANothing-but-bed-day, Occasional Roll-Up! Bebopping.

properties.name: de Young Museum
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy  de Young Date, closed cafe, the hunger sets in.
